‚úÖ When withdrawing assets to a Centralized Exchange (CEX), Please withdraw from Osmosis to Keplr wallet first.

‚ùå DO NOT put a CEX address in Osmosis ''Withdraw To'' field.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Include Memo for CEX when sending from Keplr wallet to CEX address.

üëâ CEX will not process an IBC transfer correctly, this can be avoided by following the above steps.

üëâ Due to active updates between browsers, web interfaces and wallets, it can sometimes be hard to pinpoint the exact cause of an issue.¬†

Make sure of these please:
1. Use Chrome browser only. Check if your Chrome version is up to date ( chrome://settings/help ).
2. If you are using Chrome, clear cache cookies from the browser ( chrome://settings/privacy )
3. Check if your Keplr version is updated.
( To update keplr wallet, please follow this guide- https://help.keplr.app/articles/updating-your-chrome-extension )
4. Turn-off (Not delete) all other extensions like metamask etc, while making Txs using Keplr.
5. Close all other tabs on google chrome while using keplr. Sometimes the popup gets hidden/covered by other live pages/windows.
6. After trying above all and if it doesn't work, Restart your PC and check again.

üß™What percentage of OSMO in my LP position will be staked?üí¶
To start with, according to Prop 157 (the proposal initiating superfluid staking), 50% of the underlying OSMO will be used in the ATOM/OSMO pool. This is known as the superfluid discount factor, and it can be changed by Osmosis governance.

Therefore, for example, if you put in $100 dollars of total assets, $25 worth of OSMO will be superfluid staked. The $50 worth of ATOM will provide a safety buffer, since the whole LP is slashable. 

(Note: The proportion of ATOM to OSMO will change from 50/50 as OSMO and ATOM change price. The chain logic will keep track of these changes and give you credit for your OSMO accordingly.)

When other chains start using interfluid staking, the other half of a pool will no longer provide extra collateral, so it may make sense to set the superfluid stake percentage at 90%, for example, to provide a margin of safety.

Slashing is what happens when validators misbehave badly, double-signing a transaction or colluding to attack the chain. Bonded assets can be burned to raise the costs of such an attack. In the case of superfluid staking, any slashed funds will be sent to the Osmosis Community Pool. Slashing is another reason to be thoughtful about your validator selection.

Welcome to the official documentation for Osmosis, an advanced automated market maker (AMM) protocol that allows developers to build customized AMMs with sovereign liquidity pools.
Built using the Cosmos SDK, Osmosis utilizes Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) to enable cross-chain transactions.

https://docs.osmosis.zone/

How to remove dust from an LP
 
1)In order to remove small amounts from an LP, you'll first have to add some liquidity.

2)You can accomplish this by selecting add/remove liquidity and adding at least 0.25 of a token you do have available to the LP.

3)After this, you can refresh your page and select add/remove liquidity again, and you can now remove 100% liquidity üëç

üß™ EPOCH occurs daily at 17:15 UTC ~ The timer can be seen on top of the Pools tab where it says: "Reward distribution in"

During Epoch the following rewards are distributed:

Liquidity Mining Rewards (including SFS rewards), for providing bonded liquidity are paid directly
into your wallet in the form of OSMO.  (check the "Assets" tab after 17:15 UTC)

Staking Rewards, are paid in the form of OSMO for delegating your tokens to a validator.
These can be claimed daily by connecting to your Keplr wallet

How to SFS-

üî∏If you are SF staking first time, Add liquidity -> Bond in 14day gauge -> Select SFS option -> Choose a Validator -> Confirm and Done.

üîπIf you are adding more liquidity (or daily rewards) to the previously SF staked pool, just add liquidity and bond it in the 14day gauge. It adds automatically to SF staking to the previously chosen validator.  

üß™Note that Normal LP bonding can not be done in a 14day SFS pool, if you have SF staked previously.

‚öõÔ∏è IBC is an interoperability protocol for communicating arbitrary data between arbitrary state machines. IBC can be used to build a wide range of cross-chain applications, including but not limited to token transfers, interchain accounts (delegate calls between two chains), non-fungible token transfers and oracle data feeds.  https://ibcprotocol.org/

üí§ IBC is production ready. However, all new technologies should be used with caution.

Your transaction has to be relayed which will take some time to confirm on both chains. If there is any kind of problem, IBC has a built-in mechanism that will refund your assets to the original address. In some cases this can take up to an hour. Please be patient, your funds are safu

üß™What is Interfluid Staking?üí¶
Interfluid staking is under development. It is essentially superfluid staking for the other side of your LP position, e.g. the ATOM side of ATOM/OSMO. Osmosis is creating a module for other chains to use that will enable them to determine how much of their asset is in the pool over time. They can then use that asset to secure their own chain, subject to slashing if the validator misbehaves.

To use Keplr with Ledger, please follow the steps in these guides

https://support.ledger.com/hc/en-us/articles/360013713840-Cosmos-ATOM-?docs=true

https://help.keplr.app/articles/how-to-connect-your-ledger-with-keplr-extension

‚Ñπ Troubleshooting tips:
If you are experiencing issues with your Ledger Nano in Keplr Wallet, the following might help:

‚úÖ Make sure you have selected the correct Ledger account within Keplr before interacting with osmosis.zone
‚úÖ Use CTRL + SHIFT + R to refresh & clear cache on the Osmosis website before interacting with Keplr.
‚úÖ Make sure you are using the Cosmos app on your Ledger
‚úÖ Disable and re-enable Keplr Wallet extension
‚úÖ Unplug your Ledger from USB, close all open web browser windows (Chrome or Brave), and reopen only one web browser.

Liquidity Mining are incentives to reward liquidity providers for their contributions and give them an ownership stake in the future of the protocol.The process for earning these liquidity incentives is known as liquidity mining. While many within the Cosmos ecosystem are familiar with concepts like staking rewards and community pools, Osmosis is the first Cosmos project to introduce liquidity incentives.
https://bit.ly/3sER0n8

Listing on Osmosis is permissionless
There is no need to contact any member of the Osmosis team to list. 

https://docs.osmosis.zone/integrate/token-listings.html

Keplr support is also permissionless

Any chain can add themselves to keplr

https://docs.keplr.app/api/suggest-chain.html

For external rewards -
Calculate share of that pool:
[your value divided by total pool value]  = A

Calculate the external reward per day:
[remaining reward divided by remaining days] = B

AxB = your daily external reward

üîì After unbonding, your tokens will stay locked for the chosen unbonding time (1d / 7d / 14d). Lower-timeframe bonds will continue to aggregate rewards while higher-timeframe periods are already unbonding. You will still receive rewards each day until the unbond period has fully elapsed.

üî∏After adding liquidity to a pool and then bonding your GAMM to any of the 1/7/14 day gauges, your GAMM stays bonded (locked) for an indefinite period.

üîπThe 1/7/14 day gauges are UNBONDING periods. Unbonding periods only begin after clicking 'unbond all'

üî∫To Unbond, click 'Unbond All'. Your Unbonding period now starts. Only after 1/7/14 days of Unbonding period, you will be able to remove your liquidity from the pool.

üß™Note that the bonding gauges (1/7/14 days) DOES NOT mean that you have to unbond in 1/7/14 days. Rewards are given as long as your assets are bonded. However, if you wish to unbond, you can unbond anytime (before/after/during 1/7/14days).

üö®üö®üö®HOW TO STOP SCAMMERS CALLING / ADDING YOU TO THEIR GROUPüö®üö®üö®

üîòPlease Click ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù
üîòNext Click ‚ÄúPrivacy And Security‚Äù

üîòChange the following:

-Phone number > Nobody
-Calls > Nobody
-Groups & channels > My contacts

Redelegating is instant, but there are a few restrictions related to this:

- You must wait 14 days in order to be able to redelegate from the "To" validator.
- You can redelegate from and to the same validator set only up to 7 times.

-For example, on Cosmos Hub:¬†
Redelegate Validator A -> Validator B = instant
Redelegate Validator B -> Validator C = must wait 21 days
Redelegate Validator C -> Validator D = must wait 21 days...
- Superfluid staked amount currently CANNOT be redelegated, you must unbond and wait for the 14 days then re-bond and delegate to a new validator.

‚ÄºÔ∏èRules: 
This is the OSMOSIS DEX $OSMO global chatroom. 
Keep communication respectful and disagreements mature. 
‚úÖ Price talk, jokes, and Osmosis relevant general discussions.
‚ùå Language including racism, sexism, politics, and harassment.
‚ùå No promotions for other crypto projects
‚ùå No senseless FUD
‚ùå Do not self promote (links to your own tweets, socials, etc)
‚ùå Do not beg for tips or spam the chat. 
‚ùå Do not post anything associated with illegal activity.

üö® Public Safety Announcement üö®

‚ö†Ô∏è  If you are new to crypto, or a seasoned OG, please familiarize yourself with these best practices for the safety of your funds. 

‚ùå  Do not share or enter your seed phrase into ANY website. This is a big no-no in crypto - any project who does this should be questioned, named & shamed.
Your seed is the ownership of your assets. Anyone with the seed, owns your assets!

‚ùå  Block & report all direct messages! People who message you offering assistance are not your friend. They are 100% a con-artist looking to steal your crypto.

‚ùå  Do not download unverified "wallet" apps or extensions.

‚ùå  Don't use relatively unknown web browsers, as they might be slow to release security updates. Only Chrome is officially supported.

‚ùå  Keplr DOES NOT have a Telegram group for support! - Don't be one of the 100,000+ potential victims on the fake groups!
Official support: https://help.keplr.app

‚úÖ  Install Keplr wallet from the official link only: https://keplr.app

‚úÖ  Always use the verified links found in this chat. Bookmark them to be safe!

‚úÖ  Keep all backups OFFLINE. Write your recovery phrase on paper, and hide in a secure location. Don't tell anybody!

‚úÖ  Get a hardware wallet (e.g. Ledger Nano S or X) for air-gapped security. It's suggested to order directly from the original manufacturer. You won't even need to enter your seed phrase into Keplr!

‚úÖ  Before approving a wallet transaction, take a moment & check if it is what you intend to do!

üèÜ  Common sense goes a long way, but education is key to crypto safety. 

‚ÑπÔ∏è  If you have any concerns, or think you may be hacked, you can start an anonymous chat with an admin:
https://support.osmosis.zone

Note that:
üî∏Current Total Apr = OSMO + Externals (if incentivised) + Swap fee Apr, at present.

üîπNew OSMO Apr/New Total Apr is the Projected APR calculated based on 7day vol, swap fee and other factors. 

üî∫Weekly incentives adjustments are proposed every Monday and if passed, the New APRs goes into effect on Friday's epoch.  

üîªNew OSMO/New Total Apr might not remain same, as more liquidity is added to or removed from the pool.

üß™üß™What is Stableswap?üß™üß™

üü¢ Stableswap is a type of AMM that is optimized for trading stable assets like different stablecoins or different versions of wrapped assets.

‚ùìStablecoins are assets designed to be pegged to a more stable asset for its value. (USDC, BUSD, DAI, etc)

‚úÖ Developed for constant price assets.

‚úÖ Reduced slippage encourages safer trading between assets.

‚úÖ Currently integrating Stableswap in Osmosis DEX.

‚úÖ You can delegate your OSMO to a set of validators using keplr wallet or cosmostation to receive staking rewards. Rewards can be claimed daily after epoch (17:30 UTC) and are not distributed automatically. If you unstake your tokens they will stay locked for the unstaking period (14 days). You will not receive rewards during this unstaking period related to: #validators
üîì After delegating your tokens to a Validator you will receive rewards each day until you choose to undelegate. Rewards for staking can be claimed daily at epoch 17:30 UTC

Swap fees are fees charged for making a swap in an LP pool. The fee is paid by the trader in the form of the input asset. Pool creators specify the swap fee when establishing the pool. The total fee for a particular trade is calculated as percentage of swap size. Fees are added to the pool, effectively resulting in pro-rata distribution to LPs proportional to their share of the total pool.

Tax Tools You can download a CSV of all your trades by connecting to the Osmosis info dashboard. Osmosis is also integrated into several tax-reporting tools such as: üìñ Stake.tax - download a spreadsheet of all your trades. üìñ App.sycamore.tax - newer app for downloading transaction history; more focused on Cosmos chains like Osmosis. üìñ Koinly.io - full portfolio tracker and crypto tax reporting service. Automatically sync transactions from CEXes and decentralised wallets, including Osmosis, or import a CSV from stake.tax or Sycamore. Similar alternatives: Accointing, Cointracker, and CryptoTaxCalculator. These sites will never need more than your public wallet address or a read-only API from your exchange. Be wary of seed-phrase phishing sites if you use a search engine to find a tax reporting tool.

How to bring USDC to Osmosis The most liquid USDC on Osmosis is Axelar-wrapped. If you have USDC on Ethereum, you can bridge it directly to Osmosis with the Axelar bridge (satellite.money). On other chains, you will need to obtain axlUSDC to be able to bridge it to Osmosis. If you do not have axlUSDC you can swap to it in these liquidity pools: üîó Avalanche: Swap USDC.e to axlUSDC: https://curve.fi/#/avalanche/swap üîó Polygon: Swap USDC to axlUSDC: https://curve.fi/#/polygon/swap üîó Fantom: Swap USDC to axlUSDC: https://curve.fi/#/fantom/swap üîó BSC: Swap BUSD to axlUSDC: https://ellipsis.finance/pool/0x6731D8ce7C52FEc9136cf3b7d122C032C46fF58f

‚úÖ Distribute your stake between a number of reliable validators to minimize slashing risk and improve stability of the network.

‚ùåAvoid top 10 validators (to decentralize the network). Stake to middle ranked validators.

‚ùå‚ò†Ô∏èAvoid delegating to Centralised Exchange validators (i.e. Binance, Coinbase etc)

üíöUptime should be from 98% to 100%

üëçCommission starting from 5% (percentage you share rewards with validators)

üß™ Validator contributed for Cosmos community (who develops charts/bots/tools/governance proposals etc..)

üí™Validator who participates in the Governance regularly and has higher Voting Participation.

(Check Validator's Voting History here- https://hathornodes.com/validator_voting_history/osmosis)

üî•Select Relaying Validators who clear IBC congestions. 
( List can be found here https://docs.osmosis.zone/osmosis-core/relaying/ibc-relayers-list )
